page.title: 12'GREEN BELT'LAND,WINGERWORTH
page.content: The main topic of conversation in Wingerworth is{the controversial plan {to build on the North-East Derbyshire {Green Belt land. }This is an area of agricultural land, which in 1984, was established as an area for preservation. Not only is it a home for wildlife, but it also separates Wingerworth from the rest of Chesterfield. The field in question is owned by the {Coop.,}they rent it out to a local farmer for grazing land. But they now want to sell it to{Adlingtons,}the builders. The feeling against the proposed development is so strong that a petition signed by the majority of residents was presented to{Coop.}and {Adlingtons}at a{public meeting}held to discuss the matter. No decision has yet been made.
